intro: Hippuris verticillata, commonly known as the water plantain, is a perennial aquatic plant native to temperate regions of Europe, Asia, and North America. It thrives in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. The plant has long, slender leaves that are typically arranged in a whorled pattern around the stem. Its small, greenish-white flowers appear in late spring to early summer, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Hippuris verticillata plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various invertebrates and amphibians.
